author: Nonman642

text:
Wowow hold it, at 2:50 I had a strange scenery in front of my eyes:
Ninten, Loid and Ana beaten down..Ninten slowly rises walking completely exhausted towards Giegue. After he focused Giegue shortly he turned around slowly, looking at Loid and Ana who were now able to look him in the eyes..he smiled.He turned back to Giegue, stretched out his arm and twisted time and space around them making them both disappear into another dimension..and to be honest with that song it drove tears into my eyes..

author: The Classochist

text: I haven't even planned the details. I just thought of the frames, and I'm open to changing from what didn't work out.
author: The Classochist

text: You should ever plan sequels for anything.Sequelsshould grow out of what worked the first timearound, dropping everything thatdidn't. Take Silent Hill: For the sequel, the dropped the doofus brigade cult and kept the intersting ideas abut psychology. They didn't plan  that.
author: Ben

text:
18 bosses planned for first one.
21 bosses for second one.
30 bosses for third one.
That's only major bosses, so I'm not counting mid-bosses.
Not to mention: 1st one: 201X, 2nd one: 211X, 3rd one: 301X
It makes more sense to separate them.
And that's only IF they can happen.
author: The Classochist

text: why the fuck would you plan sequels instead of just making it all part of one game?
author: Ben

text: I'll never forget this song, I'll never forget any of these games. I can't even describe my feelings, this series has a way of making me feel ways I have never felt before.
author: mmaaat123

text: I want to be a game designer also. I have a game planned, a sequal, and a threequal. I even made it based off the best games ever (in my opinion, that is) and even came up with the exact stats for bosses, party members, and temporary members. I also designed the areas of the game, the designs, names, and abilities per level of all party members. Finally, I wrote up most of the story and best dialogue. It sucks that I can't afford to make it into an actual game.
author: The Classochist
